TemporalDirections.TEXT: ,Character,Dialogue,EpisodeNo,SEID,Season 52900,KRAMER,"(Tired) Oh, I can't go on. I gotta take a break. (Sets the rickshaw down - taking a rest)",17.0,S09E17,9.0 52901,NEWMAN,"Well, don't tarry. I'm behind schedule as it is.",17.0,S09E17,9.0 52902,KRAMER,(Stretching) Oh..,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52903,NEWMAN,(Scared) Boy.. Boy. Kramer!,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52904,KRAMER,Woah! Wait!,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52905,NEWMAN,Ahhh! Yaaaahhh!,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52906,ZACH,"(Optimistic) Well, this is the first day of the rest of my life!",17.0,S09E17,9.0 52907,NEWMAN,Waaaaahhhh!,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52908,[Setting,Bookstore],17.0,S09E17,9.0 52909,JERRY,George? What are you doin' here?,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52910,GEORGE,I can't sell the book. It's been marked.,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52911,JERRY,(Sarcasticly joking) It certainly has.,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52912,GEORGE,"So, I'm gonna steal another one, and then return it. That way, everything is even.",17.0,S09E17,9.0 52913,JERRY,"(Trying to straighten things out) You defile one book, steal another, ask for your money back - and to you that's even?",17.0,S09E17,9.0 52914,GEORGE,I'm goin' in!,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52915,MANAGER,Did you want to speak with the manager?,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52916,JERRY,Yes. My Uncle Leo was cought shoplifing here the other day..,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52917,MANAGER,"Yes, Uncle Leo. I remember him. I'm sorry, our policy is we prosecute all shoplifters.",17.0,S09E17,9.0 52918,JERRY,"(Pleading) Oh, come on. He's just a lonely old man. All old people steal.",17.0,S09E17,9.0 52919,MANAGER,"That's right. That's why we stopped carrying batteries. Look, I'll be honest with you, we've had a lot of trouble with theft lately - and my boss says I have to make an example to someone.",17.0,S09E17,9.0 52920,JERRY,So it could be anyone?,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52921,MANAGER,I.. guess. As long as we catch him in the act.,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52922,JERRY,That guy! (Pointing at George) Swarm! Swarm!,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52923,GEORGE,No! Jerry!,17.0,S09E17,9.0 52924,ALL (singing),Happy birthday to you.,18.0,S09E18,9.0 52925,WALTER,Thanks.,18.0,S09E18,9.0 52926,FEMALE WORKER,"Elaine, cake?",18.0,S09E18,9.0 52927,ELAINE,"Uh, no, thanks.",18.0,S09E18,9.0 52928,FEMALE WORKER,It's Walter's special day.,18.0,S09E18,9.0 52929,ELAINE,"You know, there are 200 people who work in this office. Every day is somebody's special day.",18.0,S09E18,9.0 52930,MALE WORKER,Elaine! Where're you going? It's Walter's last day. We have to celebrate.,18.0,S09E18,9.0 52931,ELAINE,It's his birthday and it's his last day?,18.0,S09E18,9.0 52932,MALE WORKER,"This is other-Walter, from returns.",18.0,S09E18,9.0 52933,OTHER-WALTER,"Hey, what's going on here?",18.0,S09E18,9.0 52934,ALL,Surprise!,18.0,S09E18,9.0 52935,OTHER-WALTER,Oh guys.,18.0,S09E18,9.0 52936,OTHER-WALTER,"Elaine, it's my last day. Have a piece.",18.0,S09E18,9.0 52937,ELAINE,"All right, pile it on.",18.0,S09E18,9.0 52938,"ALL (singing, competing)",For he's a jolly good fellow...happy birthday to you...for he's a jolly good fellow...birthday to you...which nobody can deny...,18.0,S09E18,9.0 52939,JERRY,What is so bad about having a little piece of cake?,18.0,S09E18,9.0 52940,ELAINE,"It is the forced socializing. I mean, just because we work in the same office, why do we have to act like we're friends?",18.0,S09E18,9.0 52941,JERRY,Why aren't you there now?,18.0,S09E18,9.0 52942,ELAINE,"I had to take a sick day. I'm so sick of these people. By the way, I talked to Lisi, and tomorrow night's good for her.",18.0,S09E18,9.0 52943,JERRY,"You know, I shouldn't go out with a friend of yours. I foresee messiness.",18.0,S09E18,9.0 52944,ELAINE,"Yeah, you're better off sitting around here, reading comic books, and eating spaghetti at two in the morning..",18.0,S09E18,9.0 52945,JERRY,"Hey, speaking of tomato sauce, you want to come with me and George to Mario's Pizza?",18.0,S09E18,9.0 52946,ELAINE,Your old high school hangout? Why?,18.0,S09E18,9.0 52947,JERRY,They're closing. We're going for one last slice.,18.0,S09E18,9.0 52948,KRAMER,"Hey. All right. Hi. Check it out, official police caution tape. Look at that.",18.0,S09E18,9.0 52949,KRAMER,"Uh-uh-uh. Step back, son, there's nothing to see here.",18.0,S09E18,9.0

DIRECTION.text: Sets the rickshaw down - taking a rest

DIALOGUE.text: Well, this is the first day of the rest of my life!
You defile one book, steal another, ask for your money back - and to you that's even?
Oh, come on. He's just a lonely old man. All old people steal.
For he's a jolly good fellow...happy birthday to you...for he's a jolly good fellow...birthday to you...which nobody can deny

RELATION.fromText: Sets the rickshaw down - taking a rest

RELATION.toText: Well, this is the first day of the rest of my life!
You defile one book, steal another, ask for your money back - and to you that's even?
Oh, come on. He's just a lonely old man. All old people steal.
For he's a jolly good fellow...happy birthday to you...for he's a jolly good fellow...birthday to you...which nobody can deny
